body_html:
We are sorry about the negative experience you have been seeing.
Bazel support out of the box on windows is still WIP. I will recommend using cmake build for all users on windows. We are hoping early in 2018 we will be able to declare out of the box bazel support working.
In the meantime, I recommend sticking with the build scripts @snnn pointed out.

AVX, AVX2 support we have are weak, and AVX512 support is definitely missing. That is because we did not have the cycles, and we had other priorities. We are sorry about the inconvenience. But in case you would like to contribute fixes to these, I am happy to accept your Pull Requests. After all, TF is an open source project for all of us to improve.

Windows has been a difficult platform to support for us because our primary platform is almost always linux, and the build systems and compilers we need to use are very different on two platforms. We hope to be able to triage most of the reported issues, but unfortunately we have limited bandwidth.
